meanings.definition: A B vitamin that is essential for cell division and the formation of DNA.
meanings.sent1: Folate is important for helping cells divide and make DNA.
meanings.sent2: I eat foods rich in folate to ensure my body gets enough of this essential B vitamin.
meanings.sent3: The cells were having a party, but they needed folate to divide and multiply!
meanings.sent4: Her love for gardening was like folate for her soul, nurturing growth and renewal.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a colorful diagram to explain how folate is crucial for DNA formation.

meanings.definition: A natural form of folic acid found in food.
meanings.sent1: Folate in vegetables is a natural source of folic acid.
meanings.sent2: I always make sure to include folate-rich foods like spinach in my diet.
meanings.sent3: The salad was so full of folate, it practically sparkled with health!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like folate, spreading joy and nourishment wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The farmer proudly displayed his bountiful harvest of folate-rich crops at the market.
